alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 8:32AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 845 AM MST... At 831 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over San Tan Valley, or 13 miles north of Coolidge, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Queen Creek, Chandler Heights, Magma, San Tan Mountain Park, San Tan Valley, Seville and Gold Camp. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 204 and 211. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 147 and 150. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 140 and 149. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek
